author: Shubhomoy Sikdar
text:
Police personnel at the Pakistan International Airlines office after it was attacked by Hindu Sena activists in New Delhi on Thursday.— Photo: Sushil Kumar Verma

Asserting that no talks should take place between India and Pakistan, activists from a right-wing group on Thursday vandalised the regional office of Pakistan International Airlines on Barakhamba Road here.

Of the four Hindu Sena men who barged into the office and damaged furniture and equipment on Thursday afternoon, one has been arrested while the others fled before the police arrived.

According to the police, they entered all three rooms of the office, located on the fifth floor of the Narayan Manzil building, and caused damage all around.

Questioning the purpose of talks at a time when the Pathankot airbase was attacked, the activists left behind a few pamphlets documenting both their objection and a warning.

A statement issued by Pakistan’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs said the activists “harassed and threatened the PIA staff.” “We have been assured by the Indian government that it would take all the necessary steps for the security of the PIA offices in India,” it said.
title: Hindu Sena activists attack PIA office
